programme.title: Sixteen Candles, (1984, Comedy)
programme.desc: A girl turning 16 likes another girl's guy (Michael Schoeffling) and feels nobody cares about her birthday.

programme.title: Superman: Unbound, (2013, Animated)
programme.desc: Superman (Matt Bomer) battles Brainiac (John Noble) to save the Krypton city of Kandor, which is miniaturized and held aboard Brainiac's ship.

programme.title: The Sitter, (2011, Comedy)
programme.desc: The world's worst baby sitter (Jonah Hill) takes a brood of rambunctious children (Max Records, Landry Bender, Kevin Hernandez) on a wild night-time odyssey through New York.

programme.title: Four Christmases, (2008, Christmas)
programme.desc: When their plans for a holiday getaway fall apart, a couple (Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon) must spend Christmas Day trudging to a quartet of family get-togethers.

programme.title: Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn), (2020, Action)
programme.desc: Harley Quinn faces the wrath of narcissistic crime boss Black Mask and every other thug in Gotham. But things soon even out for Harley when she becomes unexpected allies with three deadly women -- Huntress, Black Canary and Renee Montoya.

programme.title: 3 From Hell, (2019, Horror)
programme.desc: Crazed killers Baby Firefly, Captain Spaulding and Otis Driftwood unleash bloody mayhem after escaping from prison.

programme.title: Balls Out, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fifth year college senior Caleb Fuller (Jake Lacy) gets his flag football team back together for one last shot at intramural football glory.

programme.title: House of 1000 Corpses, (2003, Horror)
programme.desc: Four travelers take refuge in the home of a clan of demented killers. Written and directed by musician Rob Zombie.

programme.title: Tell, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: A small-time thief (Milo Ventimiglia) makes a big score and tries to keep it from his ex-partner, his ex-wife and other greedy sorts.

programme.title: The Kill Team, (2019, War)
programme.desc: When a young U.S. soldier in Afghanistan witnesses other recruits killing civilians under the direction of a sadistic sergeant, he begins to fear that the men he's serving with might be the ones to kill him.

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: An acclaimed neurologist (Jamie Dornan) taps into the unconscious mind of a 9-year-old boy (Aiden Longworth) who has survived nine near-death accidents.

programme.title: It Follows, (2014, Horror)
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects, (2005, Horror)
programme.desc: A vengeful sheriff and two bounty hunters track a murderous family (Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, Sheri Moon Zombie) on the run.

programme.title: Everything, Everything, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: Confined to her house due to an illness, a smart and imaginative 18-year-old (Amandla Stenberg) develops a budding romance with the teen (Nick Robinson) who lives next door.

programme.title: Love Lies Bleeding, (2024, Thriller)
programme.desc: A bodybuilder heading through town to Vegas is thrust into the dangerous plot of a violent crime family when she falls into a steamy romance with her trainer.

programme.title: Spaceship Earth, (2020, Documentary)
programme.desc: In 1991 eight visionaries embark on a two-year experiment to quarantine themselves inside Biosphere 2 -- a self-engineered replica of Earth's ecosystem.

programme.title: Spaceship Earth, (2020, Documentary)
programme.desc: In 1991 eight visionaries embark on a two-year experiment to quarantine themselves inside Biosphere 2 -- a self-engineered replica of Earth's ecosystem.

programme.title: Black Adam, (2022, Action)
programme.desc: Bestowed with the almighty powers of the gods, Black Adam's unique form of justice, born out of rage, is challenged by modern-day heroes who form the Justice Society: Hawkman, Dr. Fate, Atom Smasher and Cyclone.

programme.title: Tell, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: A small-time thief (Milo Ventimiglia) makes a big score and tries to keep it from his ex-partner, his ex-wife and other greedy sorts.

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla, (1974, Science fiction)
programme.desc: An Okinawan monster-god helps Godzilla defeat his bionic double.

programme.title: Scream, (1996, Horror)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victim's daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.

programme.title: Scream 2, (1997, Horror)
programme.desc: A masked killer continues to pursue a California student (Neve Campbell) and her friends at an Ohio college.

programme.title: Scream 3, (2000, Horror)
programme.desc: Murders draw a young woman (Neve Campbell), a reporter (Courteney Cox Arquette) and an ex-policeman (David Arquette) to the set of a movie inspired by horrific events that they survived.

programme.title: Life After, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: A single mother and Indian immigrant travels to New York City to clear out her daughter's apartment.

programme.title: Traffik, (2018, Thriller)
programme.desc: A couple and their two friends embark on a weekend getaway to an isolated estate in the mountains. They soon find themselves in a fight for their lives when members of a violent biker gang show up to protect their secrets from the outside world.

programme.title: State of Play, (2009, Thriller)
programme.desc: An investigative journalist (Russell Crowe) stumbles into a cover-up of gigantic proportions as he and his partner probe the murder of a beloved congressman's (Ben Affleck) mistress.

programme.title: Gods of Egypt, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A defiant mortal (Brenton Thwaites) forms an unlikely alliance with the powerful god Horus (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) to save the world from Set (Gerard Butler), the merciless god of darkness.

programme.title: The Exception, (2016, History)
programme.desc: During World War II, a soldier (Jai Courtney) travels to a secluded mansion to investigate a mysterious German monarch. He soon finds himself entangled in a web of deceit while having a dangerous love affair with a local Jewish woman (Lily James).

programme.title: Skin, (2019, Documentary)
programme.desc: Nollywood actress Beverly Naya explores Black beauty and the practice of skin bleaching in African culture.

programme.title: It Follows, (2014, Horror)
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: St. Vincent, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: An unlikely bond forms between a single woman's 12-year-old son (Jaeden Lieberher) and the boozy misanthrope (Bill Murray) who lives next door.

programme.title: St. Vincent, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: An unlikely bond forms between a single woman's 12-year-old son (Jaeden Lieberher) and the boozy misanthrope (Bill Murray) who lives next door.

programme.title: Nine Lives, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: A workaholic billionaire (Kevin Spacey) tries to communicate with his family when a bizarre turn of events traps him inside the body of a cat named Mr. Fuzzypants.

programme.title: Invictus, (2009, Drama)
programme.desc: Following the fall of apartheid, Nelson Mandela (Morgan Freeman) tries to unite his countrymen by supporting the South African rugby team's underdog bid for the 1995 World Cup Championship.

programme.title: Blue Beetle, (2023, Action)
programme.desc: Jaime Reyes finds himself in possession of an ancient relic of alien biotechnology called the Scarab. When the Scarab chooses Jaime to be its symbiotic host, he's bestowed with a suit of armor that's capable of extraordinary and unpredictable powers.

programme.title: Vampires Suck, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: In a spoof of "Twilight" and other films, a pale vampire and a muscular werewolf try to win the heart of a beautiful teen.

programme.title: Sixteen Candles, (1984, Comedy)
programme.desc: A girl turning 16 likes another girl's guy (Michael Schoeffling) and feels nobody cares about her birthday.

programme.title: Margaret, (2011, Drama)
programme.desc: Feeling responsible for a fatal traffic accident, a high-school student lashes out when her attempts to make amends meet with opposition.

programme.title: Lady Bird, (2017, Comedy)
programme.desc: A teenager (Saoirse Ronan) navigates a loving but turbulent relationship with her strong-willed mother (Laurie Metcalf) over the course of an eventful and poignant senior year of high school.

programme.title: The Accountant, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: The Lighthouse, (2019, Thriller)
programme.desc: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects, (2005, Horror)
programme.desc: A vengeful sheriff and two bounty hunters track a murderous family (Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, Sheri Moon Zombie) on the run.

programme.title: Anthropoid, (2016, History)
programme.desc: In December 1941, two Czech soldiers (Cillian Murphy, Jamie Dornan) parachute into their occupied homeland to assassinate Nazi officer Reinhard Heydrich (Detlef Bothe).

programme.title: The Watchers, (2024, Horror)
programme.desc: A 28-year-old artist gets stranded in an expansive, untouched forest in western Ireland. Finding shelter, she unknowingly becomes trapped alongside three strangers who are stalked by mysterious creatures every night.

programme.title: Confidence, (2003, Crime Story)
programme.desc: A con man (Edward Burns) and his crew swindle a gangster's accountant, then try to repay him by stealing from a crooked banker.

programme.title: Confidence, (2003, Crime Story)
programme.desc: A con man (Edward Burns) and his crew swindle a gangster's accountant, then try to repay him by stealing from a crooked banker.

programme.title: Batman: The Killing Joke, (2016, Animated)
programme.desc: Batman (Kevin Conroy) must save Commissioner Gordon (Ray Wise) from the Joker's (Mark Hamill) twisted quest to drive him insane.

programme.title: Denial, (2016, Drama)
programme.desc: Writer David Irving (Timothy Spall) wages a legal battle against historian Deborah Lipstadt (Rachel Weisz) after she accuses him of denying the Holocaust.

programme.title: Sully, (2016, Drama)
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Scream, (1996, Horror)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victim's daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.

programme.title: Scream 2, (1997, Horror)
programme.desc: A masked killer continues to pursue a California student (Neve Campbell) and her friends at an Ohio college.

programme.title: Scream 3, (2000, Horror)
programme.desc: Murders draw a young woman (Neve Campbell), a reporter (Courteney Cox Arquette) and an ex-policeman (David Arquette) to the set of a movie inspired by horrific events that they survived.

programme.title: The Secrets We Keep, (2020, Thriller)
programme.desc: In post-World War II America, a woman, rebuilding her life in the suburbs with her husband, kidnaps her neighbor and seeks vengeance for the heinous war crimes she believes he committed against her.

programme.title: Cut Bank, (2014, Thriller)
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse when a murder witness (Liam Hemsworth) in small-town Montana tries to leverage the crime into a get-rich-quick scheme.

programme.title: Good Hair, (2009, Documentary)
programme.desc: Comic Chris Rock explores how hairstyles affect the self-esteem, activities and relationships of African-Americans.

programme.title: The Assistant, (2020, Thriller)
programme.desc: Digital assistants are programmed to help people. However, when one such bot goes rogue, it ends up becoming a nightmare for its owner, who is stepping into new beginnings.

programme.title: Good Time, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A bank robber stops at nothing to free his brother from prison, launching himself into a nightlong odyssey through New York's dark and dangerous criminal underworld.

programme.title: The Exception, (2016, History)
programme.desc: During World War II, a soldier (Jai Courtney) travels to a secluded mansion to investigate a mysterious German monarch. He soon finds himself entangled in a web of deceit while having a dangerous love affair with a local Jewish woman (Lily James).

programme.title: Four Christmases, (2008, Christmas)
programme.desc: When their plans for a holiday getaway fall apart, a couple (Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon) must spend Christmas Day trudging to a quartet of family get-togethers.

programme.title: Rollerball, (1975, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A corporate dictator (John Houseman) tries to oust the star player (James Caan) of a brutal 21st-century spectator sport.

programme.title: A Fistful of Dynamite, (1971, Western)
programme.desc: A thief and a dynamite-tossing Irish revolutionary inadvertently become embroiled in the Mexican Revolution.

programme.title: The Mask of Zorro, (1998, Adventure)
programme.desc: The fabled avenger (Anthony Hopkins) trains an uncouth protege (Antonio Banderas) to drive a Spanish tyrant out of California once and for all.

programme.title: Marlowe, (2022, Thriller)
programme.desc: Detective Phillip Marlowe becomes embroiled in an investigation with a wealthy family in Bay City, Calif., after a beautiful blonde hires him to find her former lover.

programme.title: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, (2016, War)
programme.desc: Six members (James Badge Dale, John Krasinski, Max Martini) of the Annex Security Team defend the U.S. Consulate in Benghazi, Libya, from an attack by Islamic militants.

programme.title: Apollo 13, (1995, History)
programme.desc: Astronauts Jim Lovell, Fred Haise and Jack Swigert try to return to Earth after an explosion aborts the April 1970 moonshot.

programme.title: The Fighter, (2010, Drama)
programme.desc: Having earned a shot at a world championship, boxer Micky Ward (Mark Wahlberg) reunites with his estranged brother (Christian Bale) to train for the fight and become the new "Pride of Lowell.".

programme.title: Creed, (2015, Drama)
programme.desc: Long-retired boxer Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) agrees to train Apollo Creed's son (Michael B. Jordan) to become a fighter, even as the former champ battles an opponent deadlier than any he ever faced in the ring.

programme.title: Crimson Tide, (1995, Thriller)
programme.desc: Two U.S. Navy officers (Denzel Washington, Gene Hackman) clash aboard a nuclear submarine bound for Russia, while that country is under rebel siege.

programme.title: The Natural, (1984, Drama)
programme.desc: The almost mythical ability of a middle-aged baseball player rockets a major-league team toward the 1939 pennant.

programme.title: Sabrina, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Sons (Harrison Ford, Greg Kinnear) of a Long Island tycoon become romantic rivals for the chauffeur's daughter (Julia Ormond).

programme.title: Marathon Man, (1976, Thriller)
programme.desc: The CIA and a Nazi death-camp dentist (Laurence Olivier) chase a New York graduate student (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: Marathon Man, (1976, Thriller)
programme.desc: The CIA and a Nazi death-camp dentist (Laurence Olivier) chase a New York graduate student (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: The Return of the Pink Panther, (1975, Comedy)
programme.desc: Bungling Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) once again seeks the Pink Panther diamond and maddens his boss (Herbert Lom).

programme.title: 1984, (1984, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Orwell's Big Brother is watching as Winston Smith (John Hurt) and his lover (Suzanna Hamilton) defy authority in bleak Oceania.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate, (2004, Thriller)
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: We Were Soldiers, (2002, War)
programme.desc: A lieutenant colonel and approximately 400 U.S. troops battle 2,000 North Vietnamese soldiers in 1965.

programme.title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners, (2023, Thriller)
programme.desc: Hoping to leave his dark past behind him, former assassin Finbar Murphy leads a quiet life in a coastal Irish town. However, when terrorists show up, he must soon choose between exposing his secret identity and defending his friends and neighbors.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise) goes on the lam to uncover the truth behind a major government conspiracy that involves the death of U.S. soldiers.

programme.title: A Working Man, (2025, Action)
programme.desc: Levon Cade left behind a military career in the black ops to live a simple life. However, when human traffickers kidnap his boss's daughter, his search to bring her home uncovers a world of corruption far greater than he ever could have imagined.

programme.desc: Luke Ellis wakes up at The Institute, a facility that abducts teenagers with psychic powers; Ms. Sigsby, the place's charismatic director, claims they're saving the world; Tim Jamieson hides from his haunted past as a small-town night knocker.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke bonds with the other Front Half residents and begins plotting his escape; Ms. Sigsby manages the fallout from a security breach; in town, Tim begins to look into The Institute, only to find himself caught up in a high-stakes standoff.

programme.desc: Mako's oceanic warrior, The Legendary Fisherman, unleashes a wave of destruction by stealthily destroying Joey's monsters from the depths of the sea. Joey has to put his skills, training, and experience to the ultimate test before he's all washed out.

programme.desc: Yugi starts to break Marik's spell over Joey, but he now must duel without the Millennium Puzzle.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Casino Paradise is an artificial island owned and operated by Domino, a casino tycoon. Domino decides to run for President and brags that with $500 million to spend, the only way he can lose is if Lupin steals his campaign funds!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Political fixer Pomade Jaws trusts no one, not even his wife Laura. He's stored the scandalous secrets of various world leaders inside a voice-activated safe.
programme.sub-title: The Woman Pops Fell in Love With

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin, Jigen and Goemon have turned themselves in to the FBI, but it's all part of the plan. Their real goal is to break out old man Clyde Barlow, who was once known as a genius bank robber, to get his help with their heist of the National Super Bank.
programme.sub-title: A Classical Thief and a Myna

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Isamu Kondo III, grandson of the leader of the Shinsengumi, hires Lupin and his gang to recover a golden cannon sunk by the Shogunate forces in the Tsugaru Strait. After much effort, the valuable golden cannon is finally recovered from the deep ocean.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Ellery Queen, the owner of the legendary sapphire called "The Eye of Solomon," is also the owner of a football team. Lupin, coming for the sapphire as announced, discovers Queen on the brink of death.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The 3rd Thieves Olympic is about to be held in Japan, and Lupin and Jigen are in it to win it! After winning the first and second Thieves Olympic, if they also win this year's getaway race, they'll become the first-ever Triple-Crown winners!
programme.sub-title: Through the Flowers or Storms, The Thieves Race

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The world's largest diamond has been discovered in South Africa and Lupin has his eyes on the prize. But as it turns out, stealing it is the easy part!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko decides to marry Huffner for his jewelry collection, disregarding the rumor that Huffner's brides always die a mysterious death within a few weeks of their wedding. Turns out, he's also a collector of brides and likes them permanently preserved!
programme.sub-title: A Wedding Dress Doesn't Suit Fujiko

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Jigen receives a letter from Sister Angelica and heads to the African country of Borodias. Sister Angelica wants Jigen's help to rescue Dr. Othello, the leader of the country's independence movement.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO tries a different approach to capturing Lupin: Astrology. It enlists the help of Marianne, a clairvoyant who can read Lupin's actions using astrological predictions and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko calls Lupin from Professor Pot's lab, but since Lupin is half-asleep, Jigen takes the call instead. Fujiko claims Professor Pot has accidentally invented a robot that manufactures diamonds, but Jigen doesn't believe a word she says and hangs up.
programme.sub-title: Diamon's Shining in the Robot's Eye

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko has invited Lupin and company to a classical concert conducted by Kyoransky from the International Philharmonic. After they get a good look at Kyoransky's baton, studded with a a diamond worth at least 200 million yen.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin goes to prison intent on making Silver tell what he did with the loot, only to discover that a new top-of-the-line prison was built over the site where he hid the money. Will the operation to trade an execution for the recovery of the money succeed?
programme.sub-title: The Last Gift in Prison is Cup Ramen

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is after the Golden Bell, symbol of the monarchy of Beltenberg and precious tourist attraction. However, the bell that sparkles in the belfry is just a brass replica.
programme.sub-title: Fujiko, Men are A Sorry Lot!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Zenigata is taken hostage from ICPO headquarters. The terrorists demand to swap him with their boss Napoleon XI, but ICPO refuses. Since Zenigata is no further use to them, the terrorists are bound to kill him; but Lupin is to the rescue?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Smith Gang hit-man company was once the best in the business, but they're suffering now from tough competition. Though the company chairman Smith considers running TV ads to revive his business, he can't think of a good way to do it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Though Joe Spade was once a formidable hitman of renown and Jigen's sharpshooter coach, he now comes to beg for Jigen's help; he had gotten old, flubbed a hit contract, and is now on the run.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: ICPO Bureau Chief Jasmine is an able commissioner. She uses the governor to spur Zenigata into action, as she has a secret plan to arrest Lupin. But Jasmine's plan is to make this mission her very last at ICPO so she could get married.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Nightlight Mask murdered the Duke of Le Mond and stole his diamonds. ICPO is having trouble solving the case, so they induct mystery author Conan Dorill as a special inspector. Dorill deduces that the true identity of Nightlight Mask is Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: On a night of thunder and rain, a man gives Lupin a doll. The next day there is a news report that a diamond called the Phoenix's Tear had been stolen. Lupin's been caught on security cameras, but he has no recollection of having done the deed.
programme.sub-title: When the Devil Calls to Lupin

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin's target is the Vatican Crown, located at the North Pole. He devises a plan to thwart pesky Fujiko, which is to relocate penguins at the South Pole to the North Pole.
programme.sub-title: Lupin's North Pole, South Pole Adventures

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The World Crime Prevention Devices Association has developed the "killer safe" that sent many safe crackers to their graves. But Lupin takes the challenge to steal what it guards.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin crashes crime boss Markane's masquerade party, but the party was just a ruse to entrap Lupin. Lupin gets hung by rope in the dark and is made the target of Markane's murder game in ten rounds, of which players have to hit the target.
programme.sub-title: The Badder A Guy, The More Villainous He Is

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin gets called out to New York where he rescues a girl hunted by an organization called Red Spider. Lupin does everything he can to help the poor girl suffering from amnesia; he tries hypnosis on her but to no avail, he gets hypnotized instead.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Old man Piccolo had taught Lupin the art of thievery 15 years ago. Learning that his widowed wife had all of her belongings impounded by the police, Lupin promises her to get them all back.
programme.sub-title: The Merry Widow and the Robber's Quartette

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and crew sneak into Peking's Imperial Palace Museum to steal Emperor Shi's jade Mahjong set, but winds up getting chased by a gang.
programme.sub-title: Operation INVADER at the Great Wall of China

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Look who is flying above New York; it's Superman! All he does is fly around, but the town is in a panic because of his performance. In the meantime, a lot of banks get robbed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin steals a statue called the Stone Child from the Metropolitan Art Museum; he and Fujiko make their getaway in a Cessna, but they crash at the Bermuda Triangle. They encounter a ghost ship at this grave of many ships and planes.
programme.sub-title: From the Ghost Ship with Love

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Foodie and gourmet aficionado Baron Gourmel says he wants to eat Lupin's brain. He claims he'd offer his own 70-million dollar jewelry collection to anyone who could capture Lupin. Fujiko hears of it and informs Lupin right away.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin III learns that his grandfather Ars√®ne Lupin's secret treasures are buried in his grave. Lupin learns of its location with Fujiko's microfilm.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen are surrounded, as usual, as they are trying to escape after a jewelry theft. But somebody shoots at Zenigata and hits him dead on. Lupin learns of the even the next morning in the papers, and Fujiko and Goemon get implicated.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The prime minister of the Duchy of Blanco has a one-of-a-kind gold coin of Hannibal hidden in his chest; well, Lupin and crew are after it. Amidst their scheming, Jigen is challenged to a duel with a man named Stoneman.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The prime minister of France has run up a ridiculous tab with Maxim of Paris, and orders the Louvre Museum proprietor to sell a painting to cover his bill. But the proprietor doesn't want to let it go, and takes the painting out of the museum.
programme.sub-title: The Ultra Operation in the Train

programme.desc: In this final chapter of the Matrix trilogy, Neo, Morpheus, and Trinity battle to defend Zion against the onslaught of the machines that have enslaved the human race. And Neo faces the consequences of the choice made in The Matrix Reloaded.

programme.desc: It's 2084 A.D. and Doug Quaid is haunted by recurring dreams about journeying to Earths closest planetary neighbor, Mars.

programme.desc: The non-human machine ruling elite of the nuclear war-torn future has dispatched a cyborg assassin into the past to kill a young boy because he soon will be the resistance leader against the machines.

programme.desc: When John Connor sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect a young Sarah Connor, unexpected events alter the past and threaten the future for all mankind. Charged with a new mission, Reese must join forces with Sarah and her "Guardian" to save the world.

programme.desc: A wrongly-convicted man must try to survive a public execution gauntlet staged as a TV game show.

programme.title: Tigerland, (2000, Drama)
programme.desc: As a nation stands divided over the war in Vietnam, stark differences of opinion surface among the men of A-Company, triggering unexpected and far-reaching consequences.
